item.value: The Cheetah is the fastest land animal. Cheetahs can run much faster than people.
There are 195 countries in the world and there are more than 2,700 languages.
The South Pole is the least sunny placeon earth with only 182 days a year off sunshine
In 1932 Amelia Earhart became the first woman to do a solo transatlantic flight. She flew from Harbor Grace, Newfoundland, to Ireland in approximately 15 hr.
English is the second most spoken language in the world.
Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world. It is 8850 meters (29035ft) high. On May 29 1953 Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay were the first to reach the peak.
The biggest planet in the Solar System is Jupiter. It is 317 times as heavy as the earth
The moon orbits the Earth every 27.32 days
The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean in the world. It covers about 1/3 of its surface.
There are 9 planets that circle the sun. They are divided into two groups: the inner planets (Mercury, Venus,Earth, and Mars) and the outer planets (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, and Pluto).
The Population of the Earth is about 6,800,000,000 (6.80 billion) people.
The Sun's outer layer has a temperature of 6,000C . Inside the sun the temperature is 15,000,000 C.
The Universe is about 14 billion years old. The earth is only 4.6 billion years old.
The average distance from the earth to the Sun is 150 million kilometers (93 million miles). If you could travel from Earth to the Sun in a plane it would take you 17 years
The world's population grows by over 100 million each year.
The blue whale is the largest known animal on Earth. The second largest animal is the Afican elephant.
House flies have a lifespan of two weeks.
The explosion of Mount Tambora, on Sumbawa island, Indonesia in 1815 was heard 2,600 km (1,600 mi) away and has been called the loudest sound ever heard by humans.
The blue whale can produce the loudest sound of any living animal. The sound can be detected as far away as 530 miles.
Microsoft Windows was announced November 10, 1983.
